critique: The document is an order from the War Department, authorizing Major-General Hooker to take control of railroads for military operations. As the President, the primary emotion I want to elicit is a sense of confidence and assurance that the military operation will be successful. There is an element of fear that I want to reduce, and a sense of surprise at the swiftness of the action. The tone is authoritative and decisive, aiming to inspire confidence and deter any opposition. Initial scores: Joy: 1, Sadness: 1, Anger: 1, Fear: 3, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 4. Revised scores: Joy: 2, Sadness: 1, Anger: 1, Fear: 2, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 3. The initial assessment was slightly off in estimating the levels of fear and surprise. The revision better reflects the intent to reduce fear and project an element of controlled surprise.
